channel.title: Help! Getting an error when trying to run my webclient!
channel.description:
Okay, so I'm just now figuring out how to make a webclient for my server. All was running somewhat smoothly, I ran into some errors but a quick trip to the search bar solved them, except now there's a problem that I just can't find a solution to! Whenever I try to run my webclient's JAR file, I get an error telling me this:
[code]Sorry, an error has occured whilst loading [server's name here] To fix this try the following (in order): 1:Try closing ALL of your web-browser windows, and reloading 2:Try clearing your web browser's cache from tools>internet options 3:Try using a different game world 4:Try rebooting your computer 5:Try selecting a different version of Java from the play game menu I've done all possible previously mentioned steps. Someone please help![/code]
I've done all of the possible methods stated above, but none of them seem to work. Someone please help!

item.title: Help! Getting an error when trying to run my webclient!
item.dc:creator: @General_Stevie General Stevie
item.description:
@General_Stevie wrote:

Then it should work, what am I doing wrong/how can I fix it?

Read full topic

EDIT:
I’m using Marcscape Client, btw, if that helps at all[/quote]If I remember right that is delta I don’t know anything about delta I don’t even think it uses a galkon refactored client.

[quote=“General Stevie, post:3, topic:397708”]Not to be a nuicance or anything, but how would i fix this?

EDIT:
By the way, I’m following Ric’s Tutorial.[/quote]I would suggest using stevinns on r-s to be honest. it is easier to follow for galkon clients.

item.title: Help! Getting an error when trying to run my webclient!
item.dc:creator: @Eddie_Crosswall Eddie Crosswall
item.description:
@Eddie_Crosswall wrote:

You most likely forgot to set a path to a cache folder. For example, in class36, modeldecompressor, sprites, or the raw folder path which can be found in client.java.

Read full topic
item.source: Help! Getting an error when trying to run my webclient!
